title: The 10 players most likely to be dealt before today's MLB trade deadline
content: From D-backs pitchers to a whole lot of Orioles, here are the players you should watch as the 6 p.m. ET deadline nears -- and their best fits.

title: Sources: Padres acquiring closer Miller from A's
content: The San Diego Padres are acquiring Mason Miller in a trade with the Athletics, sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan, adding the hard-throwing reliever to their already talented bullpen.

title: Sources: Bengals to sign ex-Seahawks TE Fant
content: Tight end Noah Fant, a 2019 first-round draft pick, is expected to sign with the Bengals, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Thursday.

title: Commission loosens prohibition on NIL payments
content: The College Sports Commission has loosened its blanket prohibition on athletes receiving payments from NIL collectives, according to a memo the new enforcement agency sent to athletic directors Thursday morning.

title: Brady questions Rooney's attitude at Birmingham
content: Birmingham City minority owner Tom Brady has questioned his side's former manager Wayne Rooney's work ethic and called some of the squad from the 2023-24 season "lazy and entitled."

title: Police: Vegas casino supervisor sold gunman rifle
content: A man who killed four people at a Manhattan office building bought the rifle he used in the attack and the car he drove across the country from his supervisor at a Las Vegas casino, authorities said.

title: Arenas arrested on illegal poker game charges
content: Gilbert Arenas was arrested in connection with a federal indictment that alleges the former NBA star hosted illegal high-stakes poker games at his mansion.

title: Who makes the Year 2 leap? The top 10 sophomores to watch for the 2025-26 NBA season
content: From top 10 picks to Year 1 breakouts, who are the most interesting players to watch in their sophomore season?

title: New Hall of Famer Antonio Gates was a beloved teammate, remains a San Diego legend
content: Gates transformed the tight end position, and he remains remarkable to those who witnessed his exploits.

title: Lions what to watch for in HOF game
content: The Lions meet the Chargers in the HOF game with all-new coordinators, a retooled O-line and a battle at QB2.

title: Phillies get their closer by landing Twins' Duran
content: The Phillies acquired star closer Jhoan Duran from the Twins, who get right-hander Mick Abel and catcher Eduardo Tait, both prospects, in return.

title: Mets keep fortifying bullpen, get Cards' Helsley
content: The Mets traded three players to the Cardinals for closer Ryan Helsley, who was expected to serve as the setup man in New York for Edwin Diaz.

title: Red Sox add to staff, acquire Matz from Cards
content: The Red Sox struck a deal with the Cardinals for veteran left-hander Steven Matz, with Boston sending minor league first baseman Blaze Jordan to St. Louis in return.

title: Astros get utility infielder Urias in trade with O's
content: The Astros acquired utility infielder Ramon Urias from the Orioles in exchange for minor league pitcher Twine Palmer.

title: Cubs add righty Soroka, send 2 prospects to Nats
content: The Cubs acquired pitcher Mike Soroka from the Nationals for two prospects and reliever Andrew Kittredge from the Orioles for another prospect.

title: M's get Ferguson from Pirates to bolster bullpen
content: The Mariners, in search of bullpen help, finalized a deal to acquire lefty reliever Caleb Ferguson from the Pirates in exchange for minor leaguer Jeter Martinez.

title: After twin dealt, Rogers goes from Giants to Mets
content: Hours after his identical twin brother, Taylor, was traded from the Reds to the Pirates, Tyler Rogers was traded from the Giants to the Mets for three players.

title: Reds acquire Gold Glove 3B Hayes from Pirates
content: The Reds have acquired third baseman Ke'Bryan Hayes from the Pirates in exchange for reliever Taylor Rogers and prospect Sammy Stafura.

title: Ranking every prospect dealt before the MLB trade deadline: There's a new No. 1 -- again!
content: You know the major leaguers on the move -- but what about the potential stars of tomorrow headed the other way in those deals?

title: The real most valuable players on every NFL team: Who would return multiple first-round picks via trade?
content: This exhaustive NFL trade guide factors in ability, positional value, contracts and age to figure out which players are really worth a first-round pick.

title: Five trades that make too much sense: Which teams should make a deal now?
content: As teams look to finalize their rosters, Seth Walder proposes trades that could help all sides involved.

title: Wetzel: Next NFLPA boss should understand the job
content: NFLPA adventure with Howell shows the union has lost focus in finding leaders driven to represent labor.

title: Premier League 2025-26 kit ranking: Every new jersey released so far
content: Why should you have to wait until all of the Premier League kits are out before you see them ranked? Here's every 2025-26 jersey that's been released.

title: It's time for The Ocho! Check out the 2025 schedule, plus how to watch every event
content: It's time for the 2025 edition of The Ocho! Check out how to watch T-Rex races, paintball, dog surfing and more alternative events on ESPN now.

title: Panic or patience? What to do with Aaron Judge on the IL
content: With Aaron Judge spending time on the IL, what should fantasy managers do without the best hitter in the league?

title: Expert picks, best bets: How Taira can avoid an upset loss at UFC Fight Night
content: Din Thomas makes his pick for Taira vs. Park and a betting insider finds value bets on this weekend's MMA cards.

title: Joshua vs. Paul? Can Pacquiao win a title? Who's the best featherweight?
content: Nick Parkinson discusses what could be next for Anthony Joshua, Manny Pacquiao, Teofimo Lopez and Oleksandr Usyk.

title: How Chris Bey's life changed after one routine move went catastrophically wrong
content: After a life-changing spinal cord injury, Chris Bey wasn't expected to walk again. Nine months later, he's not only walking, he is eyeing a return to professional wrestling.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool reach verbal agreement with Isak
content: Liverpool have taken another step closer to signing Newcastle United's Alexander Isak. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: USWNT newcomers ranked: All 24 players who have debuted under coach Emma Hayes
content: The USWNT roster has undergone sweeping change under coach Emma Hayes. Let's rank the new players by how likely it is they'll represent the U.S. at the next World Cup.

title: Otters To Return To Delhi Zoo After Two Decades
content: After more than 20 years, Otters are set to make a comeback at the National Zoological Park in Delhi, pushing the zoo's species count to 96, further enriching the Biodiversity on display.

title: US Weaponising Economy To "Dictate Its Will" To Iran, India: Tehran
content: Iran on Thursday accused the United States of weaponising the economy and using sanctions as tools to "dictate its will on independent nations" such as Iran and India and impede their growth and development.

title: Bones Found From Sixth Site In Dharmasthala Mass Burial Case
content: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) has recovered bones during the excavation of the sixth burial site at a Hindu pilgrimage centre in Mangaluru district of Karnataka, sources confirmed on Thursday.

title: No Helmet, No Fuel: Bhopal, Indore Enforce Strict Rule From August 1
content: Starting tomorrow, two-wheeler riders in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal and Indore will not be allowed to refuel at petrol or CNG pumps without wearing a helmet.

title: After Trump's 'Dead Economies' Remark, Russian Official's 'Dead Hand' Warning
content: Deputy Chairman of Russia's Security Council Dmitry Medvedev has cautioned US President Donald Trump advising him not to disregard the dangers of those he labels "dead".

title: Top Court Recalls Orders For Liquidation Of Bhushan Steel And Power Limited
content: The Supreme Court on Thursday recalled its May 2 verdict, which had ordered the liquidation of Bhushan Steel and Power Limited (BSPL).

title: Prior Notice Before Lockout Now A Must As Madhya Pradesh Tweaks Labour Laws
content: The Madhya Pradesh Assembly has approved revised rules of the Labor Department, making it mandatory for industry management to issue a one-and-a-half-month notice before declaring a strike or initiating a lockout.

title: To Tackle 'Direspectful' Reels, Tirupati Board Bans Filming Inside Temple
content: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams has issued a strict warning against filming social media reels within the temple premises.

title: US Tariffs To Impact India's Textile Exporters In A Big Way, Say Experts
content: US President Donald Trump's announcement regarding the imposition of 25 per cent additional import duty plus penalty on goods imported from India will hit the country's textile exporters in a big way.

title: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Orders Inquiry Into Death Of Toddler
content: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami has ordered an inquiry into the death of a one-and-a-half year old child in Bageshwar district allegedly due to delayed medical treatment.

title: Adani Enterprises Q1 Results: Incubating Infra Businesses Add 74% To Consolidated EBITDA
content: There has been a substantial rise in EBITDA contribution from incubating businesses which reflects strength and scalability of Adani Enterprises Ltd's (AEL) operating model.

title: Bihar Draft Electoral Rolls To Be Published Tomorrow: Poll Body Chief
content: In a statement to the voters, the CEC said that as part of the ongoing Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls of the state, the draft electoral rolls for Bihar are being published on Friday.

title: Panel Completes Probe In Telangana's Kaleshwaram Project, Submits Report
content: The one-man judicial commission led by Justice PC Ghose, tasked with investigating the alleged irregularities in the Kaleshwaram Lift Irrigation Project, has submitted its final report to the Telangana government.

title: In Flooded Odisha, Doctor Ferries Pregnant Woman To Ambulance On Cart
content: As a pregnant woman in a flood-hit district of Odisha went into a labour at a time rains had brought life to a halt, a doctor rose to the occasion.

title: "Consensual": Court Cancels Rape Case Against 20-Year-Old Filed By Mother Of One
content: The Uttarakhand High Court has quashed a rape case slapped against a man below marriageable age by an older married woman whom he had been in a relationship with.

title: NIA Makes First Arrest In Killing Of 6 Meiteis Including Infant In Manipur's Jiribam
content: A suspect in the kidnapping and killing of three women and three children from the Meitei community in Manipur's Jiribam in November 2024 has been arrested, marking the first breakthrough in the case being handled by the NIA.

title: Unique Eggs Help Scientists Identify Insect Species In Australia Weighing As Much As Golf Ball
content: In a remote rainforest in Australia, home to deadly snakes, spiders and creepy-crawlies, scientists have discovered a new species of stick insect they believe is the heaviest ever found in the country.

title: EU Braces For Tariffs On Wine, Champagne As US Tariffs To Kick In
content: The EU said Thursday it expects its cherished wine sector to be hit along with most European products as US tariffs kick in this week, but negotiations were ongoing to secure a carve-out.

title: BJP MP Ravi Kishan, Seeking New Law On Food Prices, Uses Samosa Example
content: BJP MP and actor Ravi Kishan on Wednesday asked the Centre to make a law to regulate prices of food items served in eateries, be it hotels, restaurants, or dhabas.

title: Patna AIIMS Nurse's 2 Children Burnt Alive By Criminals At Their Home
content: Two children were burnt alive inside their home in Bihar's Patna by alleged criminals, the police said today.

title: 'Dead hand': Medvedev reminds Trump of Doomsday N-strike capabilities; war of words escalates
content: President Trump escalated tensions with India by imposing tariffs and penalty charges, dismissing their relationship with Russia. He then targeted Dmitry Medvedev, calling him a "failed former President," triggering a sharp response. Medvedev retorted that Trump's reaction proved Russia was right and alluded to the "Dead Hand" concept, a Cold War-era nuclear deterrent, in response to Trump's "dead economies" remark.

title: Trump vows to help Pak tap 'massive oil reserves': How it compares to India - top points
content: Donald Trump announced a US-Pakistan deal to develop Pakistan's 'massive oil reserves,' even saying that India may be a potential buyer. Despite Pakistan's claims of coastal petroleum, extraction progress remains limited. Pakistan relies heavily on Middle Eastern oil imports, constituting 20% of its import expenses.

title: US tariff: Trump’s rant against India undercuts his own Op Sindoor ceasefire claims - here's how
content: Donald Trump's recent criticism of India's tariffs contradicts his earlier assertion that he influenced India to halt 'Operation Sindoor' against Pakistan by threatening trade restrictions. This outburst occurred amidst parliamentary debates in India, where PM Modi refuted Trump's claim of mediation, attributing the cessation to the IAF's successful strikes.

title: 'The way she was tortured': Uma Bharti remembers Pragya Thakur, hails Malegaon verdict,
content: Uma Bharti welcomed the Malegaon blast verdict. She insisted that terror has no colour. Bharti demanded an apology from Congress and Digvijay Singh. She criticized the 'Hindu terror' narrative. Bharti remembered Pragya Thakur and her suffering. She blamed political parties for 'Bhagwa terror' label. Bharti said those who fabricated lies must be punished.

title: Microsoft becomes $4 trillion company; officially joins Jensen Huang-led Nvidia
content: Microsoft's market valuation has exceeded $4 trillion, driven by a strong earnings report and the impressive growth of its Azure cloud division, which saw a 39% revenue increase. This milestone positions Microsoft as the second company, following Nvidia, to reach this valuation. Nvidia's rise is fueled by AI-driven demand, while Apple's valuation stands at $3.2 trillion.

title: IND vs ENG | 'Don’t know why he was upset': Ganguly on Gambhir-curator spat
content: Former captain Sourav Ganguly has downplayed the recent heated exchange between India's head coach Gautam Gambhir and Oval pitch curator Lee Fortis, emphasising that such disagreements are common in cricket. The incident, where Gambhir was reportedly upset about pitch access, follows a series of tense moments in the India-England series.

title: EC worker's children burnt to death in Patna; charred bodies found on bed
content: A tragic incident has unfolded in Patna's Janipur locality, where the burnt bodies of two children were discovered in their home. Police have initiated an investigation into the cause of the deaths, which remain unknown at this time. The children's mother is employed as a security guard at AIIMS Patna, while their father works in the Election Commission, according to authorities.

title: Shubman Gill's costly call: Run out after rain break halts India’s progress at The Oval - Watch
content: After a rain break, Shubman Gill's careless run-out disrupted India's progress in the fifth Test against England. Gill, who had looked good, was dismissed for 21 due to a poor decision, ending a promising partnership. Despite the setback, Gill surpassed Sunil Gavaskar's record for most runs by an Indian in a Test series, reaching 737 runs.

title: MrBeast hits 400 million subscribers on YouTube; shares photo with CEO Neal Mohan
content: MrBeast, the world's biggest YouTuber, has achieved a groundbreaking milestone by surpassing 400 million subscribers, becoming the first creator to reach this mark. YouTube celebrated this achievement by awarding him a custom Play Button. Overjoyed by this accomplishment, MrBeast expressed his gratitude to YouTube and his fans for enabling him to pursue his passion.

title: IND vs ENG | Abhimanyu Easwaran's father breaks silence: 'I don't understand...'
content: Abhimanyu Easwaran's wait for his India Test debut extends to 961 days, sparking criticism from his father, Ranganathan, and former coach Arun Lal. Despite consistent performances, Easwaran was overlooked for the fifth Test against England, while Karun Nair received a chance. Ranganathan expressed his son's disappointment, questioning selection criteria favoring IPL performances over Ranji Trophy success.

title: Malegaon blast case: Court says 'no reliable proof' - why all 7 accused were let off
content: A special NIA court acquitted Sadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur, Prasad Purohit, and five others in the 2008 Malegaon blast case, citing lack of evidence and procedural lapses. The court stated that the UAPA could not be applied due to defective sanction orders and noted the prosecution failed to prove key evidence. Families of the deceased will receive compensation.

title: Google may face ‘major’ lawsuit as users claim facing more issues with company’s smart home devices
content: Google faces a potential class action lawsuit as users report increasing issues with Google Home devices, including misheard commands and delayed responses. Kaplan Gore LLP is investigating Google's alleged failure to fix these problems, despite the company acknowledging user frustration and promising improvements.

title: Patrick Mahomes’ mom Randi shares a tearful truth as her youngest steps into a new world
content: Randi Mahomes is experiencing a mix of emotions as her youngest daughter, Mia, prepares for high school. Randi is focused on equipping Mia with resilience and the wisdom to navigate challenges while prioritizing her emotional well-being. Randi's message resonates with parents as she balances pride with the understanding that her role is evolving into one of mentorship.

title: IND vs ENG: Ex-England captain mocks The Oval curator after recent bust-up with Gambhir - Watch
content: During a rain break in the fifth Test between India and England, former England captain Michael Vaughan playfully mocked The Oval's head curator, Lee Fortis, on air. This followed a confrontation between India's head coach, Gautam Gambhir, and Fortis regarding pitch usage. Vaughan's light-hearted mimicry added a humorous layer to the already tense atmosphere surrounding the final Test match.

title: Appeal denied: McGregor liable in Dublin hotel case, £206k damages stand
content: Conor McGregor's appeal against a civil jury verdict, which found him liable for sexually assaulting a woman in a Dublin hotel in 2018, has been dismissed by the Court of Appeal in Dublin. The court reaffirmed the original jury’s decision in favor of the complainant, Nikita Hand, ordering McGregor to pay £206,000 in damages plus legal costs.

title: IND vs ENG | 'If India lose …': Ex-Eng captain says pressure mounting on Gambhir
content: Former England captain Michael Atherton has cautioned that Gautam Gambhir's position as India's head coach could be in jeopardy if the team suffers a third consecutive Test series loss. Team India is currently trailing 1-2 against England, and Atherton emphasised the immense pressure to win that comes with leading the Indian team, given their resources and expectations.

title: Durga Puja preparation: Bengal govt to give Rs 1.10 lakh grant to each committee
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee declared a Rs 1.10 lakh grant for each registered Durga Puja committee, continuing the state's annual financial support. She urged committees to aid migrant workers returning from BJP-ruled states, highlighting the crucial role of government departments in ensuring smooth festivities.

title: 'India set to be 3rd largest economy': Piyush Goyal after Trump's 'dead economy' jibe
content: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal affirmed India's commitment to protecting its national interests in trade negotiations, following the US announcement of 25% tariffs. Goyal highlighted India's rapid economic growth, countering Trump's criticism by emphasizing its position as the world's fastest-growing major economy.

title: Maha CM Fadnavis hails Malegaon blast case verdict, says terrorism isn't saffron
content: Maharashtra's Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis and Deputy CM Eknath Shinde welcomed the acquittal of all seven accused in the 2008 Malegaon blast case, asserting it vindicates wrongly targeted individuals and removes the "false stigma" against the Hindu community. Shinde strongly criticized Congress leaders for coining the term "Hindu terrorism" to malign patriots.

title: Bigg Boss 19 Teaser: Salman Khan returns - Here's all you need to know about premiere date
content: Bigg Boss 19 is set to premiere on August 24th, streaming on JioHotstar at 9:00 PM and airing on COLORS at 10:30 PM. This season introduces a unique theme, 'Gharwalon ki Sarkaar!', shifting power dynamics within the house. Superstar Salman Khan returns as the host, promising a season filled with drama, alliances, and confrontations.

title: After Dhankhar's exit, EC finalises electoral college for vice president election
content: The Election Commission has completed the electoral college list for the upcoming Vice Presidential election in 2025. This follows Jagdeep Dhankar's resignation from the Vice President post. The list includes elected and nominated members of Rajya Sabha and elected members of Lok Sabha. The official notification for the election is expected soon.

title: IND vs ENG: India's warhorse! Mohammed Siraj joins Kapil Dev, Vinoo Mankad in elite list
content: Mohammed Siraj achieves a rare feat, joining Kapil Dev and Vinoo Mankad as the only Indian bowlers to play all five Tests of an overseas series thrice, securing 10 or more wickets each time. As India trail 2-1 against England, Siraj's 14 wickets so far makes him a key player in the crucial final Test at The Oval.

title: Gill becomes 4th Indian captain to lose all five tosses — Check who the others are
content: Shubman Gill faced a setback by losing his fifth consecutive toss in the ongoing Test match. He became the fourth Indian captain to achieve this unwanted record in a five-match series. This losing streak marked India's fifteenth consecutive toss loss in international cricket. Gill now shares this fate with former captains Lala Amarnath, Kapil Dev, and Virat Kohli.

title: 'Saffron terror narrative fell flat': BJP corners Congress after Malegaon blast acquittals, demands apology
content: A special NIA court acquitted all seven accused in the 2008 Malegaon blasts case, citing lack of evidence. BJP leaders slammed the Congress for fabricating the "Hindu terror" narrative, demanding an apology. Owaisi questioned the probe, while the Congress defended its record, asserting that terror has no religion. Victims' lawyer plans to challenge the acquittal in higher court.

title: Canucks may regret trading Dakota Joshua to Maple Leafs: Frank Corrado
content: The Vancouver Canucks recently traded Dakota Joshua and Arturs Silovs, sparking debate. Frank Corrado suggests losing Joshua, known for his physicality and scoring, might be more impactful than trading Silovs, given Vancouver's goaltending depth. The Canucks aim to free up cap space to address their need for a second-line center, prioritizing roster balance and future flexibility.

title: Top 5 entertainment news: Saiyaara producer on viral videos of fans crying and more
content: Bollywood buzz is heating up! 'Saiyaara' producer Akshaye Widhwani is touched by fans' emotional reactions. Shabana Azmi defends her intimate scene with Dharmendra, praising Karan Johar's sensitivity. Aditya Roy Kapur emphasizes communication in modern relationships. Vikrant Massey and Rani Mukerji are anticipated to win National Film Awards, while Mumtaz considers a comeback, prioritizing roles that honor her legacy.

title: IND vs ENG: Captain Gill breaks 47-year-old record! Surpasses Gavaskar to become ...
content: Shubman Gill has surpassed Sunil Gavaskar's 47-year-old record for the most runs by an Indian captain in a Test series, amassing 737* runs against England. His impressive performance includes four centuries, with a high score of 269. Despite India trailing 2-1 in the series, Gill's leadership and batting prowess have been a standout, marking a new chapter in Indian cricket.

title: Urvashi Rautela's Rs 70 lakh jewellery gets stolen from London airport; actress claims
content: Urvashi Rautela claims her luxury bag containing jewellery worth Rs 70 lakhs was stolen at London's Gatwick Airport after her Emirates flight from Mumbai. The actress, who was in London for Wimbledon, reported the missing Christian Dior bag and expressed disappointment at the lack of assistance from airport and Emirates officials. She has urged authorities to investigate the security breach.

title: 'Refugees or illegal entrants?' SC questions Rohingyas' status in India
content: The Supreme Court is set to determine the status of Rohingyas in India, prioritizing whether they are refugees or illegal immigrants. This decision will dictate their rights and protections, as well as the justification for potential deportation by the government.

title: IND vs ENG 5th Test: Did Kumar Dharmasena save a DRS for England?
content: During the 5th Test between India and England, umpire Kumar Dharmasena's gesture indicating an inside edge off Sai Sudharsan's bat sparked social media buzz. Replays confirmed the edge, saving Sudharsan from an LBW. India faced early setbacks, losing both openers cheaply, leaving Sudharsan to stabilize the innings in challenging conditions after losing the toss.

title: Tool that can remove cancer-causing forever chemicals from water in minutes
content: Scientists have engineered a device that eliminates over 99% of carcinogenic PFAS from drinking water within five minutes. This innovative tool, featuring a metal-organic framework (MOF), not only purifies water but also glows upon detecting contamination, enabling real-time monitoring. The reusable filter maintains high efficiency even after multiple uses, offering a sustainable solution to combat widespread PFAS pollution affecting millions.

title: Chhattisgarh 'human trafficking' victim accuses Bajrang Dal of 'coercion'
content: A woman in Chhattisgarh, allegedly trafficked and coerced into conversion, accuses Bajrang Dal activists of forcing her to give a false statement and claims police mishandled her statement. She asserts she willingly traveled with the nuns for work, while her parents vouch for their innocence. Bajrang Dal denies the allegations, stating CCTV footage will reveal the truth.

title: IND vs ENG: India field different XI in every match; three remain unused
content: India's cricket team, led by Shubman Gill, faced constant changes in their playing XI throughout the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series against England. Despite frequent reshuffling based on conditions and workload, some players like Kuldeep Yadav, Arshdeep Singh, and Abhimanyu Easwaran didn't get a chance to play.

title: Gabrielle Union melts hearts with video recapping daughter Kaavia’s growing years
content: Gabrielle Union shared a video of her daughter Kaavia's growing years. Dwyane Wade also commented on the post. The video received love from fans and family. Kaavia is the inspiration for Gabrielle Union's book, Shady Baby. The book became a New York Times bestseller. Gabrielle and Dwyane often talk about their parenting style. They inspire others on various platforms.

title: 'Busy day' at White House: 25% tariff on India, 'dead economies' jibe, deal with Pak & more
content: President Trump unveiled a series of trade actions, imposing a 25% tariff and penalties on Indian goods due to trade imbalances and ties with Russia. Simultaneously, he offered to collaborate with Pakistan on oil development, hinting at potential future exports to India. Trump also announced trade measures against Brazil and South Korea, while criticizing Canada's stance on Palestinian statehood.

title: 961 days of wait: Easwaran warms the bench as others race ahead of him
content: Abhimanyu Easwaran's wait for his Test debut extends beyond 961 days, despite multiple call-ups and team tours. While 15 other players have debuted since his initial selection, Easwaran remains a reserve, witnessing leadership changes and younger players being preferred. His patience is being tested, having been part of major Test series without getting a chance to play.

title: Trump’s 25% tariff on India: Oppn fires at PM Modi; here's who said what
content: Donald Trump's tariff announcement triggered reactions from Indian opposition leaders. Rahul Gandhi criticized the Modi government's economic policies. Asaduddin Owaisi condemned Trump's actions. Mallikarjun Kharge questioned Modi's silence. Pawan Khera mocked the foreign policy. Shashi Tharoor expressed concerns about trade relations. Priyanka Gandhi Vadra questioned Modi's diplomatic efforts. Akhilesh Yadav worried about the economy and employment.

title: ChatGPT launches Study Mode for students: Free to use in India; step-by-step guide
content: ChatGPT introduces 'Study Mode' in India. This new feature helps students with studies and exam preparation. It is available for free. Students can now get simplified explanations. They can ask subject-specific questions. The AI tool also provides quizzes. This makes learning more accessible. It is designed to improve efficiency. This is a major educational upgrade for Indian students.

title: 'We may have to walk away': Shashi Tharoor on 'unreasonable' demands by US
content: Shashi Tharoor voiced serious concerns over Trump's proposed tariffs on India, warning of potential damage to trade relations. He highlighted the unreasonableness of US demands and suggested India should explore diversifying its markets if negotiations fail. Tharoor emphasized India's strong domestic market and its ability to withstand potential trade disruptions, advocating for strong support for negotiators.

title: Dharmasthala horror: Human bones recovered from mass burial site
content: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) has discovered partial skeletal remains at site number 6 during the Dharmasthala mass burial case investigation. This discovery occurred near the Nethravati River's bathing ghat, following allegations of coerced burials. The remains, found at a depth of four feet, are being sent for forensic analysis.

title: IND vs ENG: Can Gill’s men defy history & avoid series defeat after five toss losses?
content: At The Oval, England's Ollie Pope won the toss and chose to bowl against India, extending India's toss-loss streak to 15 in international cricket. India, trailing 1-2 in the series, face tough odds, as historically teams losing all five tosses rarely win the series. Despite this, India aim to defy history after saving the fourth Test.

title: 'No proof that Pragya Thakur owned the bike': All Malegaon bomb blast accused acquitted
content: A special NIA court in Mumbai acquitted all seven accused in the 2008 Malegaon blast case, including Pragya Singh Thakur and Lt. Col. Shrikant Prasad Purohit, after a 17-year trial. The court cited a lack of concrete evidence, emphasizing that suspicion alone is insufficient for conviction.

title: EA Sports details major solo play changes for Madden NFL 26 Ultimate Team
content: upcoming iteration's Ultimate Team mode will feature a 12-game gauntlet every week . it will be the primary stomping ground for players to tackle challenges with escalating difficulty . the new Solo Champions mode is aimed at making MUT more attractive .

title: 🏈 CFB's toughest and easiest schedules for '25
content: college football is for the first time in history sharing revenue with athletes . the start of the 2025 season is less than a month away . schedule strength tends to look a lot different in July than it does in the past .

title: ‘No longer with NDA’: O Panneerselvam-led AIADMK faction ends ties with BJP
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Olympic gold: Phelps to teach Ravens to swim
content: the Baltimore Ravens are making the biggest splash in the NFL . Michael Phelps agreed Wednesday to teach the Ravens how to swim . he is a huge Ravens fan who won an Olympic record 23 gold medals in swimming .

title: 2026 class rankings: Texas Tech moves into top 25
content: at least four top-50 prospects are expected to make announcements over the next month . the top classes could see some more big changes before week 1 kicks off . OT Keenyi Pepe has double-digit ESPN 300 commits, with several joining the list .

title: Insurance RB rankings: Charbonnet, Guerendo lead the way
content: Zach Charbonnet is a priority insurance running back for fantasy managers . this concept applies to fantasy football . he was rostered in just 22% of ESPN leagues entering Week 1 . but he emerged as a league winner after the Buccaneers' week 11 bye .

title: Free agency Power Rankings: Where the Rockets, Raptors and others land this offseason
content: the 2025-26 offseason is in full swing . some teams are settling in with their newly acquired superstars . the Houston Rockets acquired 15-time All-Star Kevin Durant from the Phoenix Suns in June . other veteran names were also on the move this offseason .

title: News: Acuna to IL; Soto, Chourio and Happ hurt
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . there has already been a flurry of activity with the expectation of more moves coming, right up to the 6 p.m. ET cutoff .

title: PLL Power Rankings entering Week 10: Chaos jump into Top 3
content: the Denver Outlaws and New York Atlas were the first two teams to clinch 2025 playoff spots . they will also face the Chaos on friday (8 p.m. ET, ABC/ESPN+), who rose up my Power Rankings this week . there isn't a weakness on this team and they share the rock .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Drake Maye has yet to throw a pick in camp
content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL, and our 32 team reporters are on the ground each day following all the action . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room .

title: Wrexham celebrate Wales' connection with Argentina in stunning third kit
content: Wrexham return to the second tier of English football in 2025-26 . the club are just one step below the premier league . a new kit has a distinct inflection of world cup holders Argentina .

title: IIT Kharagpur moves to prevent suicides, removes ceiling fans, adds ‘Campus Mothers’
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Guardians trade Bieber to first-place Blue Jays
content: Shane Bieber has not pitched in the majors since undergoing Tommy John surgery in April 2024 . the 30-year-old left-hander has made three minor league rehab starts in recent weeks . bieber won the AL Cy Young in the COVID-shortened 2020 season .

title: MLB trade deadline updates, rumors: Mariners get Suarez -- what will go down next?
content: the 2025 trade deadline is almost here, with contending teams deciding what they need to add before 6 p.m. ET on Thursday . if your favorite club is looking to add or deal away, here's the freshest intel we're hearing .

title: Historic clock tower ticks again after years of silence at Thrissur Collectorate
content: The revival effort began in March this year, when District Collector Arjun Pandian took note of the deteriorated condition of the clock tower

title: Malegaon blast verdict: M.P. BJP leaders seek apology from Congress, Digvijaya Singh
content: Indore-based businessman Shyam Bhavarlal Sahu, who was discharged from the case as accused in December 2017, recalls his time in jail stating that around 30 charges were foisted on him in the case

title: Vacation shift proposal evokes mixed reactions
content: Minister for General Education V. Sivankutty’s Facebook post on kicking off public discussions on shifting the academic year-end vacations from April-May to June-July in light of loss of working days has seen a flood of reactions.

title: Held in backdrop of Pahalgam terror attack, Amarnath yatra crosses four lakh mark
content: Lieutenant-Governor extended thanks to all stakeholders, including local Muslim service providers and doctors, for their contribution in organising the yatra this year

title: Associations collectively voice opposition against proposed mall construction in APSRTC land
content: Resolution passed to stage a massive dharna at the Old Bus Stand, the proposed site for construction of the mall, on August 6 against government’s decision to hand over  4.5 acres of land to UAE-based Lulu Group

title: NH 66 widening work in Kanniyakumari expected to be completed by April 2026
content: The work in Tamil Nadu came to a stand still after L&T Constructions ended the contract because of land acquisition hurdles and other issues; officials now say they are facing hurdles in getting construction material

title: PM Modi, UAE President stress on deepening collaboration between two countries
content: Both leaders spoke over the phone and reaffirmed their mutual commitment to further strengthening the bilateral Comprehensive Strategic Partnership between India and the UAE.

title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar unveils projects worth ₹574 crore in Muzaffarpur
content: Projects include road over bridges and road widening works; Mr. Kumar interacted with social security pensioners in which beneficiaries thanked him for increasing the pension amount from ₹400 to ₹1,100 per month

title: Bihar SIR: Day ahead of publication of draft roll, CEC assures voters on claims of inclusion and exclusion
content: Physical as well as digital copies will be given to all recognised political parties in Bihar in all 38 districts by District Election Officers  of Bihar, he says in his message

title: Navy takes delivery of first Project 17A frigate Himgiri from GRSE
content: Himgiri is a reincarnation of the erstwhile INS Himgiri, a Leander-class frigate, that was decommissioned on May 6, 2025, after 30 years of glorious service to the nation

title: Kerala likely to get below-normal rain in August, September
content: Halfway through the southwest monsoon, State had received normal rainfall. There was an even distribution without any major extreme spells

title: Researchers at IIT-Madras develop agricultural waste-based packaging material
content: They have established NatureWrks Technologies, a start-up incubated by the institute, to develop and commercialise the product

title: INDIA bloc to intensify stir on SIR beyond Parliament
content: Opposition to march to Election Commission headquarters next week, taking their protest beyond Parliament; Rahul Gandhi, Tejashwi Yadav to campaign against SIR in Bihar in second and third weeks of August

title: Classes halted as school building declared unsafe in Alappuzha
content: It was alleged that a fitness certificate was issued to the 50-year-old school building without proper inspection

title: No category named ‘suspicious voters’, Law Minister tells Rajya Sabha
content: ‘The linking of Aadhaar with Electoral Photo Identity Card has not yet started,’ the ECI said via the Law Ministry

title: CPI(M) collects signatures against smart meters in Tirupati
content: Leaders allege that Adani company employees are installing smart prepaid meters when no one is available in the house; CPI(M) has been protesting the installation of smart meters for the past two months under the auspices of the Left parties

title: Railway employee suspended for dereliction of duty in Yadgir
content: He was found talking on a mobile phone for a long time ignoring passengers waiting for tickets outside the counter at the railway station

title: Govindachamy’s escape exposes vulnerabilities of State prisons
content: The jailbreak by life convict Govindachamy has exposed the institutional vulnerabilities in the Prisons and Correctional Services department of the State. C.P. Sajith and Sarath Babu George review the shortcomings in the  system and gather opinion of experts to plug the gaps in the management of prisons

title: Kerala HC expresses concern over continuing traffic snarl-ups on Edappally-Thrissur NH-544 corridor
content: Court adjourns to Monday plea by motorists to stop toll collection at Paliyekkara until flyovers and underpasses are built

title: A. Rajarajan to head Vikram Sarabhai Space Centre
content: During a career spanning nearly four decades, Rajarajan has held several positions of leadership at the VSSC. He was serving as the Director of the Satish Dhawan Space Centre, Sriharikota.

title: Kudumbashree will launch special gift hampers for Onam
content: A total of 5,000 gift hampers can be bought online through e-commerce platform Pocketmart. Kudumbashree will also be running Onam trade melas across the State.

title: CM tells officials to develop Amaravati into a blue-green city
content: Take up avenue plantation along all roads in the capital city and develop parks and green spaces to international standards, he says; suggests raising of medicinal plants in order to transform the region into a biodiversity hub containing native tree species

title: Land dispute: Munambam natives move fresh petition
content: Their earlier request to implead in a case filed by Farook College management against the Kerala State Waqf Board’s decision to enlist the disputed land as Waqf property had been rejected by the Kerala High Court

title: Kerala govt. announces mega market interventions to ease festival costs during Onam
content: Supplyco will organise 10-day Onam mega fairs in all districts from August 26 and five-day fairs in all of the 140 Assembly constituencies from August 25.

title: Conman dupes bank in Bengaluru by impersonating a software engineer
content: Accused availed himself of two credit cards from a private bank and cheated it of ₹25 lakh in six months

title: Ghose Commission of Inquiry on Kaleshwaram row submits report
content: Justice P.C. Ghose hands over report to Principal Secy. Irrigation Rahul Bojja, who in turn, submits report to CS

title: Women’s panel chairperson inspects hospital, directs officials to resolve grievances promptly
content: Nagalakshmi Choudhary interacts with patients, listens to their complaints and assesses infrastructure concerns

title: CPI(M) leader Brinda Karat terms arrest of nuns in Chhattisgarh a ‘manufactured case’
content: Alleges violation of tribal women’s rights; says police acted without investigation following Bajrang Dal complaint

title: KCCI to honour six entrepreneurs with Vanijya Ratna Award in Hubballi tomorrow
content: The Karnatak Chamber of Commerce and Industry will celebrate its 97th Founders Day along with the award ceremony in Hubballi

title: Central University of Kerala extends last date for applying for UG, ITEP courses
content: Candidates who have appeared for National Common Entrance Test are eligible to apply for ITEP programmes and those who have appeared for Common University Entrance Test for Undergraduate Programmes can register for Honours undergraduate programmes

title: Kurnool police urge students to install Shakthi App
content: Shakthi Team visiting educational institutions across the district are sensitising students on Dial 112, 181, 1098 and 1930 numbers, bad impact of social media, how to respond to eve-teasing, cyber crimes and crimes against women and children, says Superintendent of Police

title: Stage set for launch of Annadata Sukhibhava on August 2 in A.P.
content: Financial aid of ₹20,000 each per year will be given under the scheme to 46.8 lakh farmers in the State

title: CBI to handle case related to Assam engineer’s death
content: Three accused have been arrested for the death of Joshita Das, who was reportedly under pressure to clear inflated bills

title: TTD warns of legal action against those filming indecent social media reels in Tirumala
content: Such mischievous videos will not only vitiate the spiritual atmosphere but also hurt the religious sentiments of the devout, it asserts

title: Kerala University Registrar challenges his continued suspension before HC
content: The Registrar contends that the Syndicate had revoked his suspension by the V-C. The court must quash orders issued by the V-C that prevents him from rejoining duty, he says in the petition

title: Expedite work on elevated road at Kittur Chennamma Circle in Hubballi, says MLA
content: Mahesh Tenginakai has directed the officials and the contractor to take further steps to hasten the project

title: Two women actors in fray for key AMMA posts
content: Swetha Menon, and Kukku Parameswaran are in the fray for the post of president and secretary respectively. They will face actors Devan and Raveendran for their respective posts

title: Special postal stamp released to commemorate 30 years of first mobile phone call in India
content: On July 31, 1995, India entered the mobile age when former West Bengal Chief Minister Jyoti Basu made the historic call from Writer’s Building in Kolkata, the former State Secretariat, to former Union Telecom Minister Sukh Ram, in Delhi’s Telecom Ministry office
